yogaPoses.title: Downward-Facing Dog
yogaPoses.description: This pose energizes and rejuvenates the entire body. It stretches the hamstrings, shoulders, calves, arches, hands, and spine while building strength in the arms, shoulders, and legs. It can help relieve back pain, headaches, and fatigue while increasing circulation throughout the body.
instructions: Begin on your hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips
Spread your fingers wide and press firmly through palms and knuckles
Tuck your toes and lift your knees off the floor
Slowly lengthen your tailbone away from the back of your pelvis and press it toward the ceiling
Draw your sitting bones toward the wall behind you
Gently press your heels toward the floor
Allow your head to hang freely from your shoulders, ears between your upper arms

yogaPoses.title: Warrior II
yogaPoses.description: This powerful pose builds strength and stamina in the legs, groin, and core. It opens the chest and shoulders while improving focus and concentration. Named after the mythical warrior Virabhadra, this pose embodies strength and power.
instructions: Stand with legs 3.5 to 4 feet apart
Turn right foot out 90 degrees and left foot in 15 degrees
Align right heel with left arch
Extend arms parallel to the floor, actively reaching through fingertips
Bend right knee until thigh is parallel to floor, tracking over ankle
Turn head to gaze over right fingertips
Keep shoulders relaxed and directly over hips
Press outer edge of back foot firmly into the floor
contraindications: Recent or chronic hip, knee, or shoulder injuries

yogaPoses.title: Tree Pose
yogaPoses.description: A balancing pose that strengthens the legs and spine while opening the hips, groins, and chest. It improves focus, concentration, and balance while creating a sense of grounding and centeredness.
benefits: Strengthens thighs, calves, ankles, and spine
instructions: Begin standing in Mountain Pose (Tadasana) with feet together
Shift weight onto left foot and lift right foot off floor
Place right foot on left inner thigh or calf (avoid pressing directly on knee)
Find a focal point at eye level to help with balance
Once balanced, bring palms together at heart center
Option to raise arms overhead, keeping shoulders relaxed
Hold for 5-10 breaths, then switch sides

yogaPoses.title: Corpse Pose
yogaPoses.description: Despite its simplicity, Savasana is considered one of the most challenging yoga poses because it requires complete physical and mental surrender. It deeply relaxes the body and mind, reducing stress, anxiety, and fatigue.
benefits: Completely relaxes the body and mind
instructions: Lie on your back with legs comfortably apart
Allow feet to fall open to the sides
Place arms alongside body, slightly away from torso with palms facing up
Close your eyes and release any tension in your face
Breathe naturally, allowing the body to become heavy
Remain still and present, letting go of the urge to move or fidget
Stay in the pose for 5-15 minutes
contraindications: Lower back injury (may need support under knees)
Pregnancy (after first trimester, lie on left side instead)

yogaPoses.title: Chair Pose
yogaPoses.description: This challenging pose strengthens the entire body while improving balance and posture. It builds heat, stamina, and determination as you hold the position of sitting in an imaginary chair.
benefits: Stimulates abdominal organs, heart, and diaphragm
Builds heat and energy in the body
instructions: Start in Mountain Pose with feet together or hip-width apart
Bend knees and lower hips as if sitting in a chair
Keep weight in heels - you should be able to wiggle toes
Reach arms overhead, palms facing each other or together
Draw tailbone down and in while lifting chest
Keep knees tracking over ankles, not pushing beyond toes
Engage core and breathe deeply

yogaPoses.title: Pigeon Pose
yogaPoses.description: One of the most effective hip openers in yoga. This pose stretches the deep external rotators, piriformis, and psoas while relieving sciatic pain. It can release deep-seated tension and emotion stored in the hips.
instructions: From Downward-Facing Dog, bring right knee behind right wrist
Place right ankle in front of left hip
Extend left leg straight back, keeping hips square
For a deeper stretch, fold forward over right leg
Keep weight evenly distributed between hips
Hold for 5-10 breaths, then switch sides
For more intensity, bend back leg and hold foot with hand in Full Pigeon

yogaPoses.title: Camel Pose
yogaPoses.description: A deep backbend that opens the entire front body, stretching the chest, abdomen, quadriceps, and hip flexors. It stimulates the nervous system and energizes the body.
benefits: Opens chest, shoulders, and hip flexors
Stretches the entire front of the body
instructions: Kneel with knees hip-width apart, thighs perpendicular to the floor
Place hands on lower back, fingers pointing down
Engage thighs and press hips forward
Lift chest and arch upper back
For full expression, reach back and hold heels
Keep neck in neutral position or gently release head back
To exit, bring hands to back for support and slowly return to upright
contraindications: Serious low back or neck injury

yogaPoses.title: Seated Forward Bend
yogaPoses.description: A classic seated forward fold that deeply stretches the entire back of the body from the heels to the neck. It calms the mind and nervous system, providing relief from stress and mild depression.
benefits: Calms the brain and helps relieve stress
Stimulates liver, kidneys, ovaries, and uterus
instructions: Sit with legs extended forward
Inhale, lengthen spine and reach arms up
Exhale and hinge from hips to fold forward
Hold onto legs, feet, or use a strap around feet
Focus on leading with chest rather than rounding forward
Allow head to relax toward legs
For deeper pose, use exhalations to fold further, keeping spine long

yogaPoses.title: Bridge Pose
yogaPoses.description: A gentle backbend that strengthens the spine, opens the chest, and stimulates the nervous system. It's therapeutic for stress, fatigue, and mild depression.
benefits: Calms the mind and reduces anxiety
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent, feet hip-width apart
Place feet flat on floor, close to sitting bones
Rest arms alongside body, palms down
Press feet and arms into floor to lift hips
Roll shoulders under and interlace fingers below hips
Keep thighs and feet parallel
Lift hips higher while keeping knees over ankles

yogaPoses.title: Crow Pose
yogaPoses.description: A foundational arm balance that builds upper body strength, core stability, and confidence. It requires focus, balance, and strength while teaching the practitioner to overcome fear.
instructions: Start in a squat with feet close together
Place hands shoulder-width apart on the mat
Bend elbows slightly and place knees on backs of upper arms
Lean forward, shifting weight onto hands
Lift one foot, then the other off the floor
Keep gaze slightly forward, not down
Engage core and round upper back
Work toward straightening arms
